comments.commentBody:
Drugs are illegal. That means that if you have them in your system, you are a criminal. Sounds a bit rough, I know, but that's the way that the government looks at it. If you are in a safety-sensitive job, the federal government requires random testing. Pre-employment testing weeds out those who might fail later. The most common tests detect weed use up to a month later. If you're in the job market, and you can't stop smoking weed long enough to get past the test to get employed.....you have a problem.
Look at the signs everywhere proclaiming a "drug-free workplace." Drug testing is often a part of a company's safety program, and is encouraged by insurance companies.
Get in a minor accident at work two weeks after you share a joint with a friend, and you're going to test dirty. That scrape on the side of your forklift isn't just damaged paint, it is your ticket to the unemployment line.
That's the way life is today.

I agree with you but think we should also mention that the side effects of psychiatric medications can also cause emotional instability ... People need so much more, this is a tough world and so many young people are lost...

http://www.jad-journal.com/article/S0165-0327(15)00287-6/abstract

I understand he used an AK-47 - the weapon of choice in the Middle East. The murderer had owned guns for years and was known as an avid hunter and target shooter. Since he was also known to be mentally ill for years, why was he allowed to own weapons? Don't we have laws against that?
So we need more laws?
Right.
You know, someone intending on murdering folks could just as well purchase fireworks and a pressure cooker, too.

Excuse me, but you need to take a logic class.
I own weapons, and have had some of them since I was a kid. I also have a concealed carry permit. Not one of my weapons has ever killed anyone, and it is extremely unlikely that will ever occur.
However, every time that you rend the limbs from a baby with a Sopher clamp, you are killing a child.
Every.
Single.
Time.
Oh, and drugs are illegal, so by definition, it's a crime.
Maybe the real problem is: War.

Close the unit, shut it down, open a store front, sell used clothes, let them continue their downward slide, or open up a USO like social center, bring in volunteers of all sorts, of all experiences, come together and welcome the  addict and the alcoholic in an atmosphere of sharing and welcoming back into society. Of course, they must stop their using. Its a two way street.

anecdotes like this are essentially a useless part of the debate--for every "marijuana saved my life" anecdote there is an equally powerful "marijuana ruined my life" one.  You should care very much about what the research says--marijuana should be removed from its current schedule I status and studied relentlessly to parse out the useful components and maximize their potential for those in need.

FALLEN 2

A man on fire
A woman shrunken as a dying cat.
A child beating his arms like a bird.
“Cockadoddledo.”

They emerge like hornets from behind a wall.
Each one inhuman.
Each one more monstrous than the last.

I could say, “Isn’t it just like a pageant?”
But we both know better than that.
Only a fool sees beauty in them.
Only a liar sings their praise.

Can a person really be transparent
Or a woman turn to stone?
When a people are exhausted
Anything is possible.
Watch as one man spontaneously combusts
While another blossoms into allegory.

See: AMERICAN LULLABY: Poems by Robert A.B. Sawyer (p. 11)
http://www.mcnallyjackson.com/bookmachine/american-lullaby-robert-ab-sawyer

What the media giveth the media taketh away.

The thrust of this article, that the media will give candidates a boom which will later go bust because of increased scrutiny, is something that I have seen for years.

I first remember it in 1972: ON April 4, 1972, Mc Govern won Wisconsin with 30 percent of the vote; on April 25, he won Mass. with over 50 percent of the vote. Suddenly, he was all the rage and his popularity soared.

In the Summer, and in that abysmal autumn, the media, perhaps with the connivance of the Nixon Administration, decided to give him bad coverage, and they did and he lost big time.

I saw it in 1984: Gary Hart was anointed, and then Mondale cried, "Where's the beef" and that fling died.

I think the media likes to create stars and then likes to see them die. It probably sells more papers, or in this day and age, more ephemeral, electronic chatter.

His short career already has him labelled as a great. He is so far ahead on the PGA Tour and leads the money list by close to $4.9 million. Jordan confirmed he will defend his Australian Open title come November in Sydney. He impressed many Aussies with not only his golf but that at only 21 years of age he exudes class, maturity and seems just a great guy. Texas has produced both Zach Johnson and Jordan Spieth. Is there something about Texas and great golfers?
The "gold standard" in golf is still Jack Nicklaus! 18 majors and 19 runner ups in majors! End of conversation.

There's a lot of Tiger trashing going on here but there probably wouldn't be a Jordan if there hadn't beenTiger. A lot of these young players cite Tiger as the reason they took up golf. When Spieth has won 14 majors we can talk about his greatness.
By "we," I believe he means his caddie and himself.

Were you watching Jordan and Jim Furyk going up the ramp after
Furyk had won the RBC? They were playing together that day and
they went to the scorekeeper's tent together with Jordan grabbing
Furyk by the shoulders, jumping up and down in his excitement for
his playing partner, and congratulating him again. It was the kid
in him - but he is no way bland.

Don't forget Rory MacIlroy who wasn't competing due to a freak accident. He is capable of going head to head with Speith. They should have great battling duels -- like Palmer and Nicklaus did -- for the next decade at least. Both have rounded games, no real weakness, plus mental toughness at a young age. Golf requires that. Dustin Johnson could round out the trio -- as Gary Player did in an earlier era --  but he needs to develop more mental toughness. Hard to tell if he ever will.
Looks like all the dams will withstand the shaking.

Lest we pile on, let's remember that depression is not a sign of moral weakness and it doesn't make someone a bad person. In fact a chemical imbalance may be largely responsible.

I've experienced depression for several years now and murderous behavior like this shouldn't obscure the nuanced reality of the condition.

Except that you can't - that Constitution thing gets in the way.
You can, however, make sure that you have gun-free killing zones that make it easy for murderers inspired by terrorism to kill innocents.
Almost all of the mass killings have been committed in areas where guns were illegal.
Boy, that was a great idea, huh?
Like Roof in SC we have an insane man with a gun. The insane and gun is what we should be concerned about rather then what the insane person was thinking.

The comparison is valid, GG.

Roof gets excused as a mentally ill lost soul while Muslims are painted with a broad brush by the actions of a few.

We have a long way to go, and the sooner people like you realize that, the earlier well get there.

The framers could have said guns or muskets but they didn't.
They used the word "arms" for a reason.
Every word in that document was fought over and debated.

Are pressure cookers and fireworks illegal?

Joe, I sympathize with what you're saying but it's just not true. The kid in Sandy Hook was closely followed by psychiatrists for years as was the one in California a few months later. Both came from very affluent, affectionate families who were aware of their problems and tried to get them help.

This is not about psychiatric help or access to it. This is about access to automatic and assault weaponry.
It is the American shame that it is easier to get a rifle and stock up on ammunition than it is to get mental health services.
Uniquely and exceptionally, ours.

Let,s stop making excuses for a terrorist extremist . I get so tired of the nonsense about drugs and a poor childhood. He made a choice we as a nation need to make some soon before the next episode occurs.

Murder ia against the law already.
We also had laws that kept guns away from those offices, making them gun-free zones.
Criminals don't obey laws.
Why do you think that they will?
Last time I checked, you could still purchase pressure cookers and fireworks.
Are you trying to make them illegal, too?
So. Please explain. The gun control rules are very tough. But only criminals can get guns?

Someone was carrying at the rally where Gabby Giffords was shot and could not react in time to protect her. The same could have happened at Hebdo.

Data is not on your side, GG. Accept reality and stop defending the entirely useless NRA.
